website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link Water Sensor is one of the best flood sensors on the market. If you're considering buying such a device, this should be the first option on your list -- especially if you don't already use a smart-home hub.
pros: D-Link's Water Sensor is smartly designed and features all the important perks to make it an effective flood detector
cons: D-Link's only real weakness is that it relies on being plugged in, which means power outages are its Achilles' heel

customer_reviews.title: Setup and test close to your router first before placing in more distant location
customer_reviews.text: This water sensor worked exactly as advertised and by following the directions exactly (hard for a guy!) the setup process was straightforward and free of issues. Recommend initial setup and testing near your wi-fi router to ensure everything works before moving it to a more distant location. If you have issues once it's moved, you probably have gone beyond reliable wi-fi range and thus might need a signal booster. The audible alarm is rather anemic but since I located it in a crawl space, I wouldn't be able to hear it anyway. During testing, It took about a minute from the first detection of water for the email message to appear on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: S. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to IPhone 6 Plus app provided
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself quite technologically capable and have automated half of my home already. After spending about an hour and a half trying to get this device to connect with my iPhone 6 Plus, I am boxing it up and sending it back. I followed the directions to the T roughly 30 times and have even tried all 3 (yes I have 3) of my wifis with no luck. The device connects to the wifi just fine, but flat out refuses to be seen by the app. If someone can somehow tell me something I have missed before tomorrow I might actually keep the thing. But for now it's a paperweight awaiting it's return.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Morrone

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of practical tech
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of tech - super simple / useable / reliable - ideal for holiday homes or vulnerable properties (e.g. Sump pump, upstairs laundry, etc) Edit - 21 Jun 17- subsequently bought a few more of these for my home (8 total) - during set up had to log-in / out of the app but overall install went fine - WPS worked easy - function tested with some water. These units are a cinch, reliable and are easy to remotely check that they are online (blue color in app) - don't understand all the nae sayers.... PS - I consider myself extremely average IT capable - no tech geek
customer_reviews.author: Hamish MacTavish

customer_reviews.title: Wifi detector.. that is NOT dependable.
customer_reviews.text: “Sorry. Please try again” is what I get whenever I check. Not even a single time that was found wifi connected when the app opens. So most of time, it stays in coma. When detected the alarm is so small by itself. It makes me ponder what D-Link were thinking since it is supposed to be remote from the user. The sensor wire is curvy: difficult to set height, especially in closed sump pit. Alarm does not get turned off until the wire gets dry. All in all, I only keep this product not to forget this dumb purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eugyne P.

customer_reviews.title: A horrible product.  False sense of security. Fail!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Don't buy! I have a failing sump pump. Two weeks ago it caught one sump failure and I was grateful and happy. This week I have had 2 sump failures where no alerts were received and both ended in major basement floods. In both cases the sump alarm was going off for hours. Also the alarm is useless in a basement or closed room. It just isn't loud enough. In both cases not a single alert sent to my phone. This product has cost me several days of clean up and frustration. Luckily I don't have a finished basement or it would be thousands of dollars too. Buyer beware. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Another Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea. Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this DCH-S160 in 2018. It broke down in 2020. The sensor actually alerted me on a small water leak this year . I fixed the leak. I was so happy with this purchased until one day in 2020 it went offline. After about 8 hours of research and reading the directions and going through the directions about 15 times my IPHONE 7 just will not connect to the DCH-S160 wifi . The DCH-S160 round white transmitter thing is not seeing my phone.So the iphone and the round white water sensor unit that's plugged into the electrical receptacle will not communicate with each other ! Dlink quit making this model too. I wonder why ?
customer_reviews.author: Melodicman

customer_reviews.title: The unit is very difficult to set up, and ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very difficult to set up, and the instructions lack enough detail to solve. I went to their help website. The first unit I purchased I got a response the same day and got the problem solved. I then purchased a second unit. I could not get it set up even thought I had the first unit working. It would respond that I had the wrong password for the unit. I again went to the help website. This time the response was very slow taking 2-3 days to respond and then resolve. I then got it working with their advise to start over with the installation. The unit interface needs to be more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN O. KETCHAM

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 years old, very frustrating and not worth it - much better out there
customer_reviews.text: Updated review after about 22 months of owning. Changing the WIFI is really is painful. I spent more time playing around with this one device, than I did with my entire network. NEVER AGAIN D LINK! NEVER AGAIN. I am buying another brand. Original review: Its just ok. There are much better products out there, and even sold on amazon. Look at the Proteus wifi sensor. This one doesnt advise when power is out, so doesnt tell us when at risk
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support needed
customer_reviews.text: Spent 2 hours trying to connect with app. Ended up having to get tech support with D Link. Needed to reset, upgrade firmware, reset again then it connected! Tested with water and app sent alert to iPhone. Voila! Don't hesitate to call Tech Support if you can't get it to work. Don't lose hours like I did! Hopefully now it works as intended. Peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: M,

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any home
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my basement right between my hot water heater and my boiler/furnace. One night I had just laid down to bed and the notification went off on my phone that it detected water. Sure enough my boiler was leaking so I was able to shut off the water before the puddle was very big and it would have leaked all night and probably another day or two before I went downstairs to find the potential disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H

customer_reviews.title: This sounded like exactly what I wanted next to our sump pump ...
customer_reviews.text: This sounded like exactly what I wanted next to our sump pump in the basement. It worked fine for a few minutes and then prompted me for a Firmware update. The update completed and prompted for a reboot of the device. After the reboot the App got stuck in a loop. It would not connect to the device anymore and kept asking for reboots. I finally called support and after 20 minutes we had it working again. The initial Firmware shipped was 1.00 so it's obviously still being developed. Also, the alarm on the device is not very loud. Someone buys this device to be warned of flooding. The alarm should be LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wernicke

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Installed this at my son's condo- worked right out of the box with his iPhone. No false triggers and we successfully tested it for sensitivity . The only downside is that it essentially hogs an entire duplex outlet. We have GFCI protection upstream for this and a whole house surge suppressor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work.....Returned
customer_reviews.text: Mark me down as another unsatisfied customer that couldn't get this thing to work. I followed the instructions to the letter and it never even saw my network even though I was 10 ft away from the router. I'm sick of companies that market this stuff without them being bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had some random water problems in my basement and was really excited about the thought of this product. I read a lot of reviews stating that it was hard to set up and issues people had which made me nervous. I decided to get it and try myself. It was really easy set up. I’m just an average Joe and I had the whole unit set up in about two minutes. I’ve tested it a few times myself with just putting water on it and it’s amazing as a text to me. Now I just hope it will pay off when I really need it most.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Aulisi

customer_reviews.title: The Android app does not connect easily to the Water Sensor
customer_reviews.text: The app is terrible; it is really poorly designed. The main problem is that it does not detect the device. It takes multiple iterations for the app to reconnect. You cannot back out of the app if a step does not work correctly in the connection sequence. I have to restart my phone to kill the app and start all over. Also, the device does not automatically reconnect to the app in the event of a power failure. You have to reset the device and try to reconnect the device.
customer_reviews.author: Efty

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for me
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Worked good for the first year then stopped working properly. I would be out and about suddenly the I got constant notifications saying water detected then water not detected. I would go home to check it and there's no water to be found. I reset and device several times but still have issues, I don't not use it anymore as it is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Long set up process
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put under a 2nd floor washing machine. The only reason I am giving it only 4 star is because it took a long time to set up. I have a very good mesh wireless system in my house and there is really no excuse for it to have taken so long to set up. Otherwise, now that it is connected I have setup IFTTT and it is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly capable of setting up everything electronic in my home. I spent over an hour trying to set up the app and connecting. I troubleshooted the connection several times but it will not connect and will even boot you off your own wifi connection requiring to enter the password again. It could complicate your other connected wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: The D-Link saved us from a lot of water damage!
customer_reviews.text: Our neighborhood water was shut off for a bit today for system maintenance. I wasn't home but got an alert on my phone about water under my washing machine. My husband was home so I texted him about it and he said the laundry room sink was overflowing. We think that our cleaners had tried the faucet that day and didn't turn them off. So when the water got turned back on we had the issue. Thank goodness I had the D-Link setup or there could have been a ton of water damage. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: CL.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but...
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Only wish, as others have noticed, that the alarm was louder to indicate what the product is supposed to do. Make you aware of water. I do not go to bed with my phone and am two floors up from the basement
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 6 months give or take
customer_reviews.text: When I had them set up and tested with water they were great. At some point, both stopped working. I tried to reset them and start over setting them up from scratch. The app would find the device but it would no longer connect to my WiFi. No changes to WiFi, same password and encryption as before.
customer_reviews.author: LenZ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this to work at all. It initially connected to the dlink app, then as soon as I unplugged it and moved it to the location I wanted it. The water sensor wouldn't connect back with the app, no matter how many times I reset it. I'm returning this. I tried calling the Dlink support number, but nobody answered, they didn't list their hours, just said they were closed.
customer_reviews.author: etrain450

customer_reviews.title: Works Occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Only works about half of the time. Have had several times where we’ve had water and sensor didn’t alarm my phone showing offline. Also reads water when no water is present. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  Saved my basement!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this under my hot tub in my basement. It sat there for months with not a peep, but when it detected the slightest bit of water I got my notification instantly! Paired up with IFTTT, I was texted, called, pinged! I was able to identify the problem quickly, saving me thousands of dollars in water damage! A must buy if you have the possibility of a water leak.
customer_reviews.author: R. Edberg

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Would not connect to my Wi-Fi, worked with D-Link to reset the device multiple times and installed it on two iPhones and two iPads which still didn't work. The device got to the step where you connect to your wifi but simply would not see wireless signals in the area, it didn't even see any of the signals in my neighborhood. They ended up RMAing the device and the one they sent me back had the same issue. Ended up sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W.

customer_reviews.title: Pain to setup but works great
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said it took a few tries for the device to be detected. Should come with clearer instructions. One thing I must add is that the link sent to your email to activate the dlink account should arrive in your inbox faster.
customer_reviews.author: Mrpekkle

customer_reviews.title: but the sensor works great. It went off as needed when the sump ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of the app for my iPhone, but the sensor works great. It went off as needed when the sump pump quit.
customer_reviews.author: bradxt

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to setup
customer_reviews.text: Difficult initially to setup. I tried setting it up by my water heater in the basement. Could not connect from Iphone to device or to my wireless network and the router is in my basement maybe 10 feet away from the water heater. I took the device upstairs to my kitchen where I was able to successfully do the setup, then I moved it back by my water heater. All seems to be working properly now.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Drucker

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and can save you a ton of money - Installed in A/C overflow pan - Alerted me to drain backup before it became a problem. Suggest using the siren from D-Link with it
customer_reviews.author: Ed Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: as described
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but it only allows one email address and you cannot use a PC for mydlinkhome. You have to use the cell phone. The sensor wire is very quick and responsive, like everyone else, the audible alarm is really quiet and useless in the basement, it's more quiet than a cloths dryer alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. If you're lucky the happy path will work. There is ZERO reliability built into this thing; i.e. if the product alarms when it is not connected to your WIFI; after it does connect you still will not get a notification even if the sensor is still alarming. For the price I expected reliable messaging to have been implemented. It has not.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Yvarg

customer_reviews.title: Good product , could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was harder than it should be but totally doable. Requires multiple steps. Product does seem to work as described. I wish the audible alarm volume could be adjusted to louder. I also wish the electronic alert was a text message, not just an inner app alert.
customer_reviews.author: Xtian

customer_reviews.title: MyDlinkHome not mydlink lite
customer_reviews.text: Works great I recommend you do not use the wps function setup manually for network connection also be sure to download MyDlinkHome and not MyDlink Lite as it only work with the MyDlinkHome app
customer_reviews.author: Mizz

customer_reviews.title: Never worked, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Sensor never worked, even after setting up WiFi and placing in cup of water to test. Changed my home WiFi and could not reconnect the sensor. Waste of money, too bad I didn't find this out until I was outside of the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan S.

customer_reviews.title: The biggest problem is that the power cord is very short and it is hard to put the sensor wire into a useful place.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and they work. The biggest problem is that the power cord is very short and it is hard to put the sensor wire into a useful place.
customer_reviews.author: Alistor

customer_reviews.title: Just In Case We Need Them
customer_reviews.text: Put these in place while we were away from home for an extended period. As we had no water leaks, can't tell if they worked or not. Nice to know we have them.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Wizard

customer_reviews.title: great water detector
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to warn of a leak. Gives alarm and notifies you on phone. Holds WiFI connection very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Wont connect
customer_reviews.text: It is a peace of junk. Will not connect to the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Works, but haven't needed it...yet
customer_reviews.text: Well i tested it out by licking the wire and it worked. So far i haven't had any leaks in my basement so i can't really comment on it it works in that regard or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: The app stinks, making the sensor worthless
customer_reviews.text: Twice, the app has gone "offline" without notifying me. How am I supposed to know it's offline and cannot detect a leak. The app is crap, making the sensor worthless.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: nice when it works
customer_reviews.text: Two out of three didnt work, nice when it works. Sucks when it doesnt. Called tech support twice for two different products they told me to return broken product. Well there goes my faith in dlink.
customer_reviews.author: Ethanfink

customer_reviews.title: Sleep and Travel in Peace
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to connect with WPS to my WiFi router. Instructions with device and online are too brief and provided no troubleshooting help. It has since reconnected fine after I had power off to install a new lighting fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Good idea; bad implementation
customer_reviews.text: This sounded like a good idea -- I really need something like this! -- but the reality was very disappointing. I struggled with setup for an hour and a half over two days and, while I got it to briefly work, once, it promptly lost its settings and went back to a never ending orange blinking light and showing a wifi signal you couldn't actually connect to. I'm sending it back. I hope someone else -- Nest, maybe -- comes up with a sensor that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality with peace of mibd
customer_reviews.text: Simple to hook up and very accurate. No false alarms and it gives us peace of mind
customer_reviews.author: diana g

customer_reviews.title: found the sensor wire to be a bit short and ...
customer_reviews.text: found the sensor wire to be a bit short and had to buy an extention for it to reach the lip of my sump pump. Also had a bit of an issue connecting to my router. Had to do it manually
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeLaPaz

customer_reviews.title: Still Working
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed four of these water sensor in January of 2017. A month later one of then alerted me to a water leak. I decided that, after 17 months, it was time to check and make sure all of them were still working. Using a spray bottle full of water I tested each one. I am happy to report they all worked and sent me a notification the water was detected.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Clunky but works
customer_reviews.text: Clunky install. Signal is low so needs to be near WiFi signal. Poor interface to google hub home.
customer_reviews.author: Falconbro

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: App stinks. Could link with my iPhone. I tried a number of different ways in different spots. Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get this to go online... very frustrating! I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: nc

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Constantly goes offline and has to be reset. Terrible product, would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford L.

customer_reviews.title: Installed pretty easy, the app instructions were reasonably clear
customer_reviews.text: Installed pretty easy, the app instructions were reasonably clear. Tested like a champ. Connected to the D-link Siren, worked great. I wish there had been step by step instructions for the that part. It is really easy, after you learn how to do it. Overall, 5 stars for sure...
customer_reviews.author: Customer 421

customer_reviews.title: If you like slitting your wrists for fun, then this product may be for you
customer_reviews.text: Like many other people have said, setup of this device is extremely painful. You have to try a combination of WPS and manual wifi connections. Took me 3 hours, your results may vary. Update:. This thing doesn't even work!
customer_reviews.author: Shelter Dawg

customer_reviews.title: App is TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Disconnected from app and now cannot authenticate on the app - tried setting up new account, keeps disconnecting me and then will not authenticate. Both sensors are now disconnected from WiFi and I have no way to re-set them up. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Near impossible to get connected to Iphone and network
customer_reviews.text: This will not connect with my local network. I had it connected but it keeps dropping the network and now won't connect at all. Lousy software.
customer_reviews.author: J E

customer_reviews.title: Keep a constant eye on water problems
customer_reviews.text: We have a new house, that apparently has some issues with water backing up. It happened twice, smaller times, then I bought the D-Link water sensor. We had 2, fairly small, water back-ups we wouldn’t have even known about if we didn’t have the sensor. While we work with a plumber to resolve the yet to be identified issue causing the problem, it’s been invaluable to have this sensor to monitor what we can’t see, saving us damage and worse headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel McGaughey

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, my app somehow signed itself off without warning, and so the one time there was a leak I received no warning on my iPhone app. The sensor works well, but the app notification is completely unreliable. I am looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: doug gottschlich

customer_reviews.title: This gives me some peace of mind with my water ...
customer_reviews.text: This gives me some peace of mind with my water heaters and boiler for my heating system in the basement. I wouldn't hear water running from down there necessarily but this will give me some warning.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works well, it was a little bit confusing to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, it was a little bit confusing to setup. Detects water very quickly. I am going to make a custom length telephone cord to put it under the water heater and have the main unit at one of the garage's outlets.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Might have to change your whole network
customer_reviews.text: Difficult setup and had to change my network settings, like my security type. Not cool, thought dLink was a legit networking company.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work and basement flooded.
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for one year and didn’t work when basement flooded. Nothing ever went off. Buy a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Ray

customer_reviews.title: Once I talked to tech support it was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems to work as advertised once you get it set up. The problem is that the interface of the app is clunky and the instructions for set up are incomplete. Once I talked to tech support it was easy to set up, but there should be better instructions and no need to make a call that takes up time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Extra Cost
customer_reviews.text: This leak detector works amazing. I use it underneath my 40 gal saltwater aquarium. It has paid for itself already. I rushed home from dinner a few weeks ago to the alarm app on my iPhone and sure enough there was a small leak in the sump. This D Link is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant based on other reviews but so far I have no complaints. I was able to link the device to my router following the instructions. I was able to configure both my Android and wife's iPhone as well. I have tested multiple times by dipping the sensor in water and was alerted every time. Time will tell if this works when I need it most!
customer_reviews.author: drwwi2002

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sends an instant signal to my cell if I have any water. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: DCH-S160 did not work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned older models that worked. This time, there out of three failed to complete the setup process. After an hour on the phone with Philippines support, I can say that this item did not function for me. The agent told me DLINK is in Taiwan (I haven’t independently verified this).
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Madere

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these. I am a network engineer, and I can get them to work, but only sometimes. Typical for D-Link home products. Unfortunately, not reliable enough for something like water leak detection. Will be returning and purchasing Wally instead, as it has received much better reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is such a cool product. It saved us twice this summer from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool product. It saved us twice this summer from basement floods due to sump pump issues. It notified me of water and within minutes we were down there taking action. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne F

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought after some flooding in my basement. I had no issues getting it set up. The biggest issue I have with the product is the length of the sensor that comes in the box. It was too short and I ended up ordering a longer sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Forest

customer_reviews.title: Has a DHCP server that poision and kills the netowrk
customer_reviews.text: has a built-in DHCP server that poison the network and cause routers to freeze.
customer_reviews.author: A. Khamari

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Well after my sump failed and my basement flooded, thought it might be time for some backup! Easy to install and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Worked once, until I moved it to a new location
customer_reviews.text: I found this device was very easy to set up. It worked with minimum fuss. I had to move it to a different outlet in the same room. I was never able to get it to reconnect again. Reset many times, went through manual install, but never got past the point of connecting to my iPhone or android to complete the setup. Returning the device. My devices indicated a connection to the dlink unit, but the apps never recognized it. A good idea but not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Elect. Eng.

customer_reviews.title: Failure when you need it most.
customer_reviews.text: Critical failure. Failed when needed it most, on first leak. Unfortunately happened after return period expired, which (knock on wood) would be the case for most people, so now stuck with an unreliable device. Audible alarm was working but too faint to hear in crawlspace where installed, but none of the app alerts, email alerts, sms texts I set up and tested to trigger on leak detection worked through D-link or IFTTT service. App showed that device was connected to internet and working, but no indication or log of leak event in D-link app/service. I suspect some kind of failure at D-link. Unfortunately happened when there was a leak, when I needed the device and service behind it working most.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jin

customer_reviews.title: terrible behavior by the company
customer_reviews.text: terrible device and terribe support. they told me to buy an extender of wifi even though it worked well without one at first. I wanted a new device they refused.They wanted me to change my wifi name temporarily. My friend ,an engineer,came to help me. We spent hours and never got it to work. Amazon has no obvious suggestion on how to get my money back or what to do with the device I bought through them.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Meltzer

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported by app DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This model is no longer supported by the app, no way to use it. The oldest version that is supported is the D-Link DCH-S161, see attached picture!! Wasted 50 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mojo Risin

customer_reviews.title: Great product. The app runs in the background on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The app runs in the background on phone giving peace of mind. Doesn't seem to use much RAM or battery.
customer_reviews.author: LLcoolJEFF

customer_reviews.title: Its painful to climb up in the attic where its installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm frustrated with this DCH S160 Water sensor, it will not connect to the wifi automatically after the router has been rebooted. Its painful to climb up in the attic where its installed for the gas water heater to detect leak. I have to climb up to reset this device every time I reboot the router. This defeats the purpose. You would imagine expensive device like this will have the capability to automatically connect back to the wifi once it comes on. Because of this frustration I'm giving it one on the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Constantly generates false positives
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Constantly generates false positives. On top of that I had to replace the wire with the sensor head 2 months after using the product.
customer_reviews.author: Zhanna O.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased only 5 months ago I consider this a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Original set up wasn't hard but, every month or so since, it has required reconnecting to the wifi. This last time, it has failed to reconnect at all. Purchased only 5 months ago I consider this a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Beaulaurier

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE
customer_reviews.text: These work for a while as described but I’ve had two sensors go bad in less than a year. I’ll be researching other products. I do not recommend these sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these sensors and alarms. Failed to configure them. Online support was no help either.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You can see your water heater status from anywhere you get WIFI. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made, local alarm worked but not very loud. Would not link to my android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Good but tips cause false alarms
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but gets false alarm often if in a humid area. Also the rubber tip seems to trip the trigger by getting moisture in it that won't get out. Had to pull both caps ultimately and leave the tip bare.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of mind, pathetic volume for alarm.
customer_reviews.text: The alarm on this unit should be much louder. It's ridiculous that you need to buy a separate unit to magnify the alarm. Otherwise I am well pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Okay product - Needs to send a status message occasionally
customer_reviews.text: I like the product in general. I thought it was relatively easy to set up. The product is definitely designed for future expansion - if this happens, do that. However, the one function the device lacks is operational feedback or health check. It would be nice if the device sent periodic (programmable perhaps) test reports that it's at least still alive and communicating.
customer_reviews.author: Americanjam

customer_reviews.title: Works very well... already had a flood ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well...already had a flood..hopefully with this gadget will be able to stop before flood happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these. Both failed after less than a month. I spent 3 hours on the phone with support who told me the device was faulty and needed to be replaced. Maybe if it had been only one device but for both to fail? Serious quality issues
customer_reviews.author: Danielle and Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: As promised. Good product. Box was damaged but product was fine
customer_reviews.author: C. Erekson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t send notifications
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get notifications during setup and testing, but when actual flooding occurred alarm sounded but no notification was sent. Frustrated, completely redid setup and confirmed notifications were working. Flooding happened again, no notification sent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. The water sensor cable was too short ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The water sensor cable was too short from the location of a wall receptacle in my utility room. Also I wish the product was compatible with Samung's SmartThings as an approved device.
customer_reviews.author: The Hurley's

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 years. Kept logging me out. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Da Guppster

customer_reviews.title: Truly atrocious setup and App
customer_reviews.text: I saw the setup problems listed in the reviews but thought "I've been in IT for years, so this thing can't beat me." As Thosereviews state, the thing is an absolute nightmare to get set up - won't connect, difficult to reset, suddenly loses all its settings, etc. After an hour or so if fiddling with it and being on hold for DLink support, I realized it wasn't worth the hassle. I've returned it and will wait for the Roost device to come out. I'm beat.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Bodzin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works flawlessly. Wish it was a little cheaper so I could install more throughout my house.
customer_reviews.author: IDS5

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would but another
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Setup was easy contrary to some of the reviews I have seen. No problem adding to my network
customer_reviews.author: RCA

customer_reviews.title: but much better than the alternative
customer_reviews.text: This item is working well for me, and already alerted me to a fast dripping leak that developed at a hot water heater connection which I was able to fix before there was flooding. The only downside was that it was in the middle of the night and woke me up, but much better than the alternative! The only issue I have had is with the WPS setup. I pushed the WPS button on my Asus RT-AC5300 router, and it started flashing the WPS light, but I could never get it to link up with the DCH-S160. I finally gave up and tried the manual install method which worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Valley Products

customer_reviews.title: lasted 1 year...died 2 weeks after wtty over!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the item 1 year and 2 weeks ago!! It stopped working...blinks red light only..tried resetting and joining my wifi both manually and wan button...will not connect...dead-o...
customer_reviews.author: savbl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.text: As reflected in a number of reviews, the sensor stubbornly refused to connect to my network. No way I’m going to spend $60 for a device I have to fight with to use. There are lots of options to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up! Only complaint as stated in other reviews the alarm is not loud enough. Works well with alert to smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Golflady

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to install and along with the IFTTT it is ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. It is easy to install and along with the IFTTT it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect to the wifi network and alert sound in very low.
customer_reviews.text: It has been 2 days I'm trying to connect this unit to WiFi network. It is so complicated. Sometimes app says product passcode is wrong. Somehow I got the product pass code in then when put the WiFi password in, it doesn't do anything. Siren sound is really low and it only beeps 1 or 2 times...
customer_reviews.author: Bambrah

product_meta.title: D-Link DCH-S160 mydlink Wi-Fi Water Sensor,White
product_meta.description: Style:WiFi Leak SensorThe DCH-S160 mydlink is a smart wireless water sensor that helps keep your home safe. It will help you detect water damage before serious problems occur. Get alerted when water is detected in basements, sinks, near a water heater, dishwashers, in a bathroom or anywhere there might be moisture. The DCH-S160 also works with the DCH-S220 mydlink Wi-Fi Siren to increase alarm volume and range. Get push notifications with the mydlink Home app on your smartphone so you always know what is going on at home from anywhere. Power Input: 100 to 240 V AC, 50/60 Hz.
feature_bullets: Receive push notifications when water is detected via mobile app
Built in alarm will sound (up to 70 dB) and LED will blink red when water is detected
Detachable cables included (35 feet non sensing and 165 feet sensor cable)
Create rules via mydlink mobile app to enable interaction with additional mydlink home automation products such as motion sensor, WiFi cameras, Smart Plugs and more
Easy set up with the mydlink Home app Operating temperature 0 to 40 degree C (32 to 104 degree F)
IFTTT compatible: Pair with any IFTTT enabled product or app to connect your WiFi Water Sensor in fun and useful ways

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars526 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
